page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY 1066-BROCK
page.content: CLAUGHTON'S CLOSEST CONECTIONS WITH THE DOMESDAY BOOK ARE THROUGH MR.FITZHERBERT BROCKHOLES WHO IS RELATED TO THE FITZHERBERTS OF DOVEDALE,DERBYSHIRE.THEIR ANCESTORS CAME OVER WITH WILLIAM THE CONQUEROR IN 1066.IT WAS THE CUSTOM THEN FOR A SON TO ADD FILS TO HIS NAME SO FILS HERBERT BECAME FITZHERBERT.THE PRESENT MR.FITZHERBERT IS THE SQUIRE OF CLAUGHTON AND OWNS ALL THE LAND TO THE WEST OF THE RIVER BROCK,MOST OF WHICH IS LET OUT TO TENANT FARMERS. MR.FITZHERBERT,WHOSE GRANDSON,JOHN, ATTENDS CLAUGHTON PRIMARY SCHOOL,MAINTAINS THE CLOSEST INTEREST IN AND CONNECTION WITH THE PARISH AND DISTRICT.
